item.title: Task List
item.description: Current Project This project (code here ) began as a simple to-do app. The user can add, edit, delete, and mark tasks as complete, as well as filter the list by pending, complete, or all tasks. It isn’t fully functional, but you can see a demo here . This project was built in Vue.js and is currently styled using vuetify. Current Version ↑ What Next? As I’ve thought about this fairly standard project, I’ve realized it doesn’t have many interesting advantages over a standard paper to-do list.

item.title: FaceOverlay
item.description: Intro FaceOverlay (also known as SmileyCluster ) is an educational tool for machine learning under development in Dr. Zhen Bai’s lab at the University of Rochester. I was able to work on the project through an NSF-funded internship over the summer of 2019. Dr. Bai and her lab were amazing to work with and I learned a lot about iterative design and experiment design through that experience. UR’s Rush Rhees Library ↑ Chernoff Faces Chernoff Faces are a tool for visualizing multivariate data.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hi, I’m Chase. I am a musician, artist, uncle, skier, mountain biker, pickleballer, and, since January, vegan. I am a recent computer science graduate from USU and I value simple, usable design. Here is a link to my current resume . This site is a work in progress and will contain more information about me and my projects soon. Stay tuned!
